results.content:
Pleas consider for your courses:
1) explain themes with enought time.
2) give time to explain the code you will write.
3) consider that the last lines of áreas of your screen are not recorded. Even recorded, they are covered by video control.
4) videos like number 3 (variables) are cut.
5) please give time explaining the install. Consider themes like requisites and what are the user to achieve on each.
In general, your videos are going too fast. It is not required they go painfully slow, but find the best space between explanations, actions and let your studens learn, not just watch a smart guy that knows what hes doing and code real fast.
results.content_html:
Pleas consider for your courses:
1) explain themes with enought time.
2) give time to explain the code you will write.
3) consider that the last lines of áreas of your screen are not recorded. Even recorded, they are covered by video control.
4) videos like number 3 (variables) are cut.
5) please give time explaining the install. Consider themes like requisites and what are the user to achieve on each.
In general, your videos are going too fast. It is not required they go painfully slow, but find the best space between explanations, actions and let your studens learn, not just watch a smart guy that knows what hes doing and code real fast.

results.content: The volumes changes per course, sometimes the volume starts loud, sometimes quiet. There are codes that weren't shown to be included but it's there already. Also, after each code change, the window switches immediately, which makes someone who follows the code change go back a few seconds and pause right before he finishes just to know what exactly was coded. Overall, it was good, this is my first primer on React, but things could be better.
results.content_html: The volumes changes per course, sometimes the volume starts loud, sometimes quiet. There are codes that weren't shown to be included but it's there already. Also, after each code change, the window switches immediately, which makes someone who follows the code change go back a few seconds and pause right before he finishes just to know what exactly was coded. Overall, it was good, this is my first primer on React, but things could be better.

results.content:
Couldn't get past the first few videos, his accent is very thick and difficult to understand. No subtitles either (except for auto-generated ones which also don't seem to be very accurate or good because of his pronunciation).

Jumps from one subject to the next without any context.

A very disappointing experience overall.
